original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade on Thursday (23) on continuous selling and profit taking, an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was down 0.87 percent or 82.84 points to 9,444.21, the most liquid index was down by S&P SL20 was down 1.22 percent or 33.68 points to 2,734.59.
“Sentiments have slowed down after the International Monetary Fund approved a loan for 2.9 billion dollars, on fears of debt restructuring,” Ranjan Ranatunga of First Capital Holdings said.
“We see investors taking positions and there is a bit of profit taking in the banking sector,” Ranatunga said.

Sri Lanka is looking at options to re-structure domestic debt, or local law local currency debt (LLLC), without harming the banking sector and announce them the International Monetary Fund said in a report.
Top losers were Sampath Bank, Hatton National Bank and Commercial Bank. (Colombo/Mar23/2023)
